summary: An email forwarded on July 14, 2019, containing a civilian complaint from Susan Harriman. It raises two primary issues: questioning the verification of Jeffrey Epstein's employment history with Bear Stearns and alleging a separate, complex financial and medical fraud case involving Ivy League cardiologists, a Cayman Islands hedge fund, Abbott Labs, and clinical trials in Colombia.

persons.name: Susan Harriman
persons.context: Author of the original email sent on July 13, 2019, raising questions about Jeffrey Epstein's professional background and alleging a separate financial/medical fraud case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose claimed employment at Bear Stearns is questioned based on a lack of licensing records in FINRA's BrokerCheck system.

persons.name: Gerardo Reyes
persons.context: A Univision journalist who reportedly obtained records from Colombia related to the alleged fraud case involving clinical trials.

connections.description: Harriman is questioning and investigating Epstein's claimed professional background, specifically his employment at Bear Stearns.
Harriman references Reyes as a journalist who obtained records for her related to a separate fraud case she is reporting.

events.title: Harriman's Email Complaint
events.description: Susan Harriman sends an email to the DOJ raising questions about Jeffrey Epstein's background and alleging a separate fraud case.

events.title: Completion of Seed Research Clinical Trials
events.description: Mentioned as the year seed research clinical trials with a cardiology focus were completed, allegedly linked to a fraud case.

keyFacts: The document questions the verification of Jeffrey Epstein's employment at Bear Stearns, citing a FINRA BrokerCheck search that shows no record of his licensing.

It alleges a separate, complex case involving two Ivy League Directors of Cardiology, a Cayman Islands hedge fund, Abbott Labs as a major investor, and $150M in cash from Colombia for clinical trials.
The alleged fraud case is linked to the Heartmate device and reports 26 deaths and 28,882 Medicare-reimbursed patient readmissions.
Journalist Gerardo Reyes of Univision is credited with obtaining records from Colombia related to the alleged fraud.
